description:
Brazil’s National Institute for Space Research (Inpe) revealed on Wednesday consolidated data showing a 21.8 percent decrease in Amazon deforestation from August 2022 to July 2023. Deforestation in the period reached 9,064 square kilometers, an area about 40 percent larger than the state of Delaware. The reduction disclosed today is similar to the 22.3 percent […]

The post Brazil cuts Amazon deforestation rate by 22 percent appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Brazil cuts Amazon deforestation rate by 22 percent

description:
Eve Air Mobility, a startup spun off Embraer’s innovation arm Embraer-X years ago, unveiled a teaser video of its first full-scale electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) vehicle “non-conforming prototype.” As we previously reported, Eve began building its flying car in the city of Taubaté, in the state of São Paulo, and plans to perform […]

The post Eve reveals first images of its under-construction flying car appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Eve reveals first images of its under-construction flying car

description:
Weather forecasts from the south indicate that the climate emergency in Rio Grande do Sul may continue for longer

The post Argentina cyclone threatens Rio Grande do Sul with more rain appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Argentina cyclone threatens Rio Grande do Sul with more rain

description:
Brazil's southernmost state is underwater after days of severe heavy rains, with the human and material tolls mounting by the hour. We examine the extent of the crisis in Rio Grande do Sul

The post Explaining Brazil #292: Southern Brazil’s climate emergency appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Explaining Brazil #292: Southern Brazil’s climate emergency

description:
Residents complain that the official response to catastrophic floods in Rio Grande do Sul state has been slow and insufficient, and say civil society has stepped in to fill the gap

The post Porto Alegre could ‘still be dry’ if flood protection systems worked properly appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Porto Alegre could ‘still be dry’ if flood protection systems worked properly

description:
Congress enacted a state of calamity that will be valid through the end of the year

The post Congress greenlights emergency funds to Rio Grande do Sul amid floods appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Congress greenlights emergency funds to Rio Grande do Sul amid floods
